Key: Heehee. Today was very fun.

It was. Let's do it again sometime. Next time,
we can invite others from our group.
...Yes.

(Kotori and the others said they were tired,
so they went home, but... I think they were
just being considerate.)

What do you want to do, Maria? Should we
stop by some place on our way home?

Shido, would it be okay for me to have
some alone time today?
Hm. Is there something on your mind?

Yes. I would like to organize my thoughts
a bit. Is that fine?

All right. Just make sure you're not out
too late.

Thank you for your concern, but I will be
okay. It is not like there is any danger here.
Got it. If anything happens, call me.
Yes. Then, Shido... I will see you.

(I watched Maria go until I could no longer
see her.)

(Since I'm out here, I'll take my time
walking home.)

Hm... Is that Arusu? What is she doing,
standing next to the sidewalk like that?

(The black-clothed Arusu stood there
nonchalantly. Maybe she's waiting for
someone.)

Actually, what does she normally do at
this time of day?

(I pondered the question while watching Arusu,
then she suddenly crossed the sidewalk.)
What is she doing? Wait, that's...

(Opposite of Arusu, an old lady was walking
along the crosswalk. However, she stopped
because she carried heavy shopping bags.)
Good grief. Must you do this in front of me?

(Arusu approached the old woman, grabbed
her bags, and continued walking.)
Hey, you can't just leave her there!

Um. Are you all right? If you'd like, I can
take your hand.

(The old woman nodded and grabbed my
hand.)

The girl over there is looking after your
bags. Here, right this way.

You were trying to help that old lady, weren't
you? Looks like you have a good side after all.

It would have ruined my mood if she were
to die in front of me. Even NPCs bleed, after
all.

(The old woman bowed her head, and left
with a smile on her face. Arusu, however,
seemed displeased.)
You did a good thing. Don't make that face.

I didn't help her because I wanted to.
I just remembered you getting upset with
me last time, Shido Itsuka.
Hm? When was I angry at you?
(Something's nagging at me...)

There is no reason for you to understand.
This conversation is over, got it?
I don't.
...Huh?
Wh-What are you doing?!

Well, you did something good. I thought
you deserved some praise.
I told you, it wasn't like...
Even so.

Enough! I'll say it again. That was not my
intention. This is beyond the point of
misunderstanding.
Then, fine. It's a misunderstanding.
Excuse me?!
It's fine. I just want to praise you.

Very well. I cannot stop you.
But why do you feel the need? I do not
understand.

Typically good things are rewarded with
praise. This should be expected.
Huh? Is that so?

Are you satisfied yet? I have no business
with you, Shido Itsuka.
That kind of hurts, you know...

Oh, there is something. Something I wish
to ask.
What is it?

Who is the first person a child receives
praise from?
Umm. Their parents, I guess.
Right. Of course. That is why I am doing this.
What did you say...?
Nothing. See you, Shido Itsuka.
There she goes again...

(Arusu's parting expression was melancholy,
but it could have been my imagination.)

I guess I'll head home. If Arusu's out, then
Maria must be home too.
